epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_code: QZ257EBMX QLD BMX-S25-7-200SLUMP ECOPact Block mix and wall systems
product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

hazardous_substances.according_to: Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_impact_categories: Environmental impacts from existing EPDs do not include impacts for EN15804+A1 and additional Green Star (v1.3) impact categories; these are modelled separately based on generic processes.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m続 of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.justification: Capital equipment and personnel impacts assumed negligible or excluded as per PCR 2019:14 and Frischknecht et al. (2007)

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage on site, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

assumptions.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities such as site work and forms

assumptions.deconstruction_method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate for various applications depending on product performance requirements

carbonation.description: Natural process where concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction with hydration products; reduces net CO2 emissions over lifetime
carbonation.recommendation: Use standard for whole-of-life building studies; carbonation not reflected in EPD results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes; conforms to EN 15804
